Xills visit the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1), where they're often known as ethereal stalkers, primarily to maraud and to kidnap creatures back to their native [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9). These four-armed, warmongering monsters paralyze their victims before implanting them with eggs using an ovipositor normally kept retracted behind their mandibles. Their single-minded drive to expand and conquer is so all-encompassing that while they work together dutifully and without dissent, there is little else in their lives. **[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 24 **[Recall Knowledge - Ethereal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 24 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19 [Xill](/Monsters.aspx?ID=866) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 299 2.0 **Perception** +15; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +15, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +14, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +12, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +14, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +15, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +12 **Str** +4 **Dex** +5 **Con** +3 **Int** +0 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Items** [Breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=10), _+1 [longbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=76)_ (40 arrows), [Scimitar](/Weapons.aspx?ID=38) (2), [Steel Shield](/Shields.aspx?ID=3) (Hardness 5, HP 20, BT 10) --- **AC** 24 (26 with shield raised) **Fort** +15 **Ref** +17 **Will** +11 **HP** 100 **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)**
**[Shield Block](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=32)** --- **Speed** 35 feet **Melee** scimitar +16 ([Forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 2d6+7 slashing **Melee** bite +16, **Damage** 2d8+7 piercing plus xill paralysis **Ranged** _longbow_ +17 ([deadly 1d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)), **Damage** 2d8 piercing **Occult Innate Spells** DC 24 - **7th** [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) (to [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9) or [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) only; self only) **Double Slash** ([Flourish](/Traits.aspx?ID=73)) The xill makes two scimitar Strikes against a single target. If both hit, combine their damage for the purpose of the target's resistances and weaknesses. The xill applies its multiple attack penalty to each strike normally. **Implant** ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Requirements** The xill is adjacent to a [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38), willing, or [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) creature; **Effect** The xill implants xill eggs in the creature's flesh. **Xill Eggs** ([Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) The [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) condition from xill eggs doesn't improve on its own until the disease is cured or runs its course. It can be cured with a 10-minute operation that requires a successful DC 26 [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) check and deals 4d6 slashing damage to the host; **Saving Throw** DC 24 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 24 hours; **Stage 1** infested with no ill effect (8 hours); **Stage 2** sickened 1 (8 hours); **Stage 3** sickened 2 (4 hours); **Stage 4** sickened 2 and 2d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) as larval xills burrow out of the body and immediately fade away into the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9) (1 hour) **Xill Paralysis** ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) A creature hit by the xill's bite Strike must attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and is immune to xill paralysis for 1 minute.
**Success** The creature is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature is [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** The creature is paralyzed. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to recover, and the save DC decreases by 1 each round.
The Ether War Xills see [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) creatures as little more than incubators, but the need for fresh hosts never abates, for on their home plane, xills are constantly at war. Only the relative emptiness of the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9) keeps their conflict with creatures like [ether spiders](/Monsters.aspx?ID=203) from becoming too overwhelming and outpacing the speed at which new ranks of soldiers can replace those who have fallen.
